name: tester
features: Based on the provided D&D 5e rules, here are the specific class features for a level 1 Ranger:

**Spellcasting:** You can cast Ranger spells using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. You know 2 level 1 Ranger spells (Cure Wounds and Ensnaring Strike are recommended) and have 2 first-level spell slots. You can use a Druidic Focus as your spellcasting focus and can change one prepared spell after each Long Rest.

**Favored Enemy:** You always have the Hunter's Mark spell prepared and can cast it twice without expending a spell slot. You regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest. This spell doesn't count against your number of prepared spells.

**Weapon Mastery:** You can use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons with which you have proficiency (such as Longbows and Shortswords). You can change which weapon types you've chosen whenever you finish a Long Rest.
Darkvision: See in dim light within 60 feet
Relentless Endurance: Drop to 1 hit point instead of 0 once per long rest
Savage Attacks: Roll one additional weapon damage die on critical hits
personality_traits:

bonds: Connected to their sailor background and half-orc heritage
flaws: Sometimes too focused on their goals to consider consequences
